alert.note: Alert for West Slopes North Cascades and Passes; Western Whatcom County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 1:11PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Whatcom County through 145 PM PDT... At 111 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mount Baker, or 23 miles east of Deming, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bellingham, Sumas, Deming, Lynden, Peaceful Valley, Everson, Nooksack, Glacier, Acme, Maple Falls, Geneva, Sudden Valley, Kendall and Marietta-Alderwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: West Slopes North Cascades and Passes; Western Whatcom County
